channel.title: Console vs. Pc
channel.description:
Which do you prefer?
I would much rather have a computer than a console because I can search the web, pirate games, map, like the interface (mouse and keyboard) better than console's, and more.

item.title: Console vs. Pc
item.dc:creator: raw_bean
item.description:
[COLOR=‘Red’]This a bad thread and you should feel bad.

Seriously, other than circular arguments about controllers and piracy, what did you hope to achieve?

item.title: Console vs. Pc
item.dc:creator: The_Minotaur
item.description:
[quote=“John Killer118”]
c) No. World of Goo is only $20, but it’s been pirated to a disgusting amount since it has no DRM. Same with Zeno Clash. Yes, they won’t even give newer and smaller developers any mercy.

I think you’ll find that Zeno Clash was pirated by its own company. They release several Copies of their game on torrent sites. So far as I know, they are doing fine because of this, people have respect for this sort of thing. I would give you an example of these torrents, but we’re not allowed to post them.

Read full topic

item.title: Console vs. Pc
item.dc:creator: John_Killer118
item.description:
garthbartin:

I am fourteen. I live in the middle of nowhere. Plus, I’m in America and Bush fucked up our economy so bad that adults aren’t getting jobs. I had a babysitting job, but not anymore. I would buy games if I could, but all my money in the world consists of a jar of change that only has pennies in it because I picked out and spent everything bigger. I would have money saved up right now but I just bought a computer with 2 years worth of savings. The only kind of job you can get in my town is growing or selling pot.

For about 4 or more years I’ve had to deal with playing games on my Dad’s ancient computer, replaying games over and over. Do you know how boring that gets? I’ve probably played Half-Life 1 5 or 6 times now, same with Blue Shift and Opposing Forces.

Before I bought my computer I did have money and I did buy games, I bought Far Cry 2, HL Anthology, Orange Box and HL2DM.

I know, It’s bad and I don’t like doing it, but I dislike not having video games even more.

Well, here’s an idea: Don’t play games until you get the money.
It’s a brilliant idea, isn’t it?

Level:

I don’t like games where you need a CD in the drive, which is why I like steam. I buy most of my games off there (aside from GTA 4, because I didn’t want to download 14 GB).
I pirate stuff, but I also buy stuff as well to support developers. I buy games, music, movies, etc, but I also pirate a bunch. Sure it’s not the same as buying everything, but it’s better then some of you assholes who pirate everything just because they can.

Yeah. You pirate stuff but it’s better than how most people pirate. You’re special. Go ahead and keep telling that to yourself, bitch.

Read full topic

item.title: Console vs. Pc
item.dc:creator: garrthbarrttinn
item.description:
blue:

you fucking reatrded ? IF you have no money, go to a fucking JOB, thats how normal ppl do it. I so hate ppl who say i steal since i have no money, i have no money since im busy stealing and then paling games.

I am fourteen. I live in the middle of nowhere. Plus, I’m in America and Bush fucked up our economy so bad that adults aren’t getting jobs. I had a babysitting job, but not anymore. I would buy games if I could, but all my money in the world consists of a jar of change that only has pennies in it because I picked out and spent everything bigger. I would have money saved up right now but I just bought a computer with 2 years worth of savings. The only kind of job you can get in my town is growing or selling pot.

For about 4 or more years I’ve had to deal with playing games on my Dad’s ancient computer, replaying games over and over. Do you know how boring that gets? I’ve probably played Half-Life 1 5 or 6 times now, same with Blue Shift and Opposing Forces.

Before I bought my computer I did have money and I did buy games, I bought Far Cry 2, HL Anthology, Orange Box and HL2DM.

Siggs:

This is a bad view. I hope your not thinking your a special case, because this is the story a fair few pirates use.

I know, It’s bad and I don’t like doing it, but I dislike not having video games even more.

Read full topic

garthbartin:

@ point a, I pirate games because I have to, I don’t have the money to pay 50 bucks every time I want a new game.I do respect game developers, but there is no way around it, either I go without games, or I pirate them. I don’t like doing it, but there is no other way.

That is why if you like the game, you can always go to the store, support the developers, and buy the game even though you have the game pirated. Sounds perfectly logic to me.

item.title: Console vs. Pc
item.dc:creator: garrthbarrttinn
item.description:
John Killer118:

a.) You’re assuming that pirates have respect for developers and publishers. They don’t.
b.) Yes. Every game needs a demo.
c) No. World of Goo is only $20, but it’s been pirated to a disgusting amount since it has no DRM. Same with Zeno Clash. Yes, they won’t even give newer and smaller developers any mercy.

A more realistic DRM plan would be a combination of the standard CD-Key, activation from services such as Steam or (in Rockstar’s case) Rockstar Games’ Social Club, and DNA testing. Again, all could of been avoided if people had respect for the developers and publishers.

@ point a, I pirate games because I have to, I don’t have the money to pay 50 bucks every time I want a new game.I do respect game developers, but there is no way around it, either I go without games, or I pirate them. I don’t like doing it, but there is no other way.

Read full topic

item.title: Console vs. Pc
item.dc:creator: Savant
item.description:
I would prefer consoles if they had keyboards and mouses (Seriously, why didn’t anyone think of this?). Yes they would look a lot like PC’s but consoles only run Games on their system, instead of running OS, like on a PC, and bunch of other programs in the background which makes any program in the foreground a little less fast.

Read full topic

item.title: Console vs. Pc
item.dc:creator: NavMan
item.description:
I got meself an xbox controller just for my PC. Playing GRID is so much more enjoyable now with slow motion replays . As for the poll, I don’t prefer one over the other. Both platforms have great games and as most Xbox360 games are ported to Windows and I have a PS3, I can enjoy the best of both worlds.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: John_Killer118
item.description:
Someonerandm:

Why is there an other option on the poll?

Handhelds and Mobile Phones I guess, but I doubt ANYBODY will pick that.

Crunchy:

I prefer console gaming because I prefer the xbox controller to any interface on earth.

Get the fuck out!
Look, I find the XBox controller bearable, but really? After a few hours of PC gaming for the first time, I couldn’t even LOOK at a controller!
I’m used to it now though, so I can still own you all in Halo 3 (yes, all five of the members in this PC gaming focused fourm that like Halo 3!)

item.title: Console vs. Pc
item.dc:creator: John_Killer118
item.description:
Brother Shrike:

best DRM there is:
a) don’t release crappy games and expect people to buy it
b) release a demo so people can try it without buying
c) don’t charge a crapload for the game. Also DLC is a good incentive if you make a system where it can’t just be pirated as well.

a.) You’re assuming that pirates have respect for developers and publishers. They don’t.
b.) Yes. Every game needs a demo.
c) No. World of Goo is only $20, but it’s been pirated to a disgusting amount since it has no DRM. Same with Zeno Clash. Yes, they won’t even give newer and smaller developers any mercy.

A more realistic DRM plan would be a combination of the standard CD-Key, activation from services such as Steam or (in Rockstar’s case) Rockstar Games’ Social Club, and DNA testing. Again, all could of been avoided if people had respect for the developers and publishers.

Read full topic
